preface.para: Odivshe is the magic of slow, cool darkness, of water and ice, the opposite of fire and action. Odivshe magi study and work their spells on water and shadow, ice and cold. They are sometimes called the wizards of gloom.

As well as these mundane elements, the Odivshe sometimes manipulate ethereal water. This "substance" takes a variety of forms, generally similar to ordinary water, but thinner, sometimes invisible. Often it is described as an "icy pallor that robs away the breath and drowns the very spirit with its dark, clinging, gloom". It takes about twice as long to drown in ethereal water, although this may be small comfort to those who have the experience. In general, ethereal water is easier to walk/run through than mundane water (half air movement rates), and more difficult to swim in (double fatigue).
The Odivshe use it because it is easier to manipulate than mundane water. Ethereal water effects ethereal creatures as mundane water affects mundane creatures. It will also quench ethereal fire.
Secondary: Fyvrian or Savoryan; Tertiary: Jmorvi or Lyahvi; Diametric: Peleahn

spell.name: Azure Hand
spell.description: A spell to gently reduce the temperature of an object. It works best on objects containing high proportions of water, and can cause minor discomfort to organic creatures. It is a good treatment for sunstroke, and can deaden pain. It causes one level of fatigue, and reduces wound penalties from wounds by one level.

spell.name: Bonal's Quenching
spell.description: Changes the water in the target's body to make it more refreshing and capable of sustaining life longer. It allows the target to survive on half as much water.

spell.name: Power of Ulmer
spell.description: Increases the buoyancy of an object, by an amount equivalent to its water content. Something with the equivalence of a human body can be affected up to size five, making it twice as buoyant, capable of even sleeping when floating, and doubling swimming speeds. Only half the amount of wood can be affected, and metal or rock can not be affected at all.

spell.name: Chill
spell.boost: +40 Temperature drops to -1C, freezing the target
spell.description: Cools an object down to four degrees celcius, of not larger than size zero. Object will begin to regain temperature again at normal rate. If the object is a living creature, then it gets to resist, though failure will probably result in its death.

spell.name: Daenin's Specter
spell.description: Causes the Shek-Pvar's shadow to become enchanted, channelling ethereal cold into whatever passes through it. Any who touch or pass over it must make a resistence roll or suffer a feeling of coldness and unease. At sunset, a person's shadow is about 150% of their height.

spell.name: Glamour of Fanon
spell.description: Reduces the temperature of an inanimate object up to size 6, by 100 degrees Celsius. The object will return to room temperature normally.

spell.name: Mouth of Lathal
spell.boost: +30 Target can breathe air and water
spell.description: Enables the target to breathe water, though does also remove the ability to breathe air as well. Creatures up to size six can be affected.

spell.name: Tarl's Crystals
spell.description: An enchantment which enlarges snowflakes, raindrops, hailstones, or other precipitation over a wide area near the caster. Generally, the maximum effect is to combine 20 hailstones/raindrops into one. Effects of this are left to GM discretion. The spell does not cause hail or rain in the first place. The effects are centred on the caster.

spell.name: Chalsa's Sponge
spell.description: An enchantment which causes the target to retain moisture. The effect can be unpredictable. In most cases sponge reduces and/or prevents thirst, and prevents or inhibits the loss of bodily fluids such as sweat, tears and urine. The spell eliminates the need for water, but does not affect thirst, so it can be used to traverse a desert, but not comfortably. After a few days, the target becomes bloated with retained moisture; they are generally immobilised after five to seven days, and die in ten.

spell.name: Shadow of Yanar
spell.description: Forms a sphere of darkness emanating from the point indicated by the caster. The region within the sphere is pitch black.

spell.name: Tarl's Alchema
spell.description: A spell to separate discrete liquids from a mixture, causing them to form strata within the container. It cannot be used to break natural liquids into their components (e.g. water into hydrogen and oxygen, but ethanol could be purified from wine), nor to extract solids from liquids. It affects 15 litres of liquid.

spell.name: Breath of Dhivu
spell.description: Causes a cone of intensely cold air to emanate forward from the caster. The affected area is an equilateral sixty degree cone. Creatures within the cone take cold damage, which can be soaked with armour. The damage done is +30 (split) at point blank range, reduced by one point for each metre to the target. The effect is primarily achieved by means of a variety of ethereal ice.

spell.name: Yavari's Spoon
spell.description: Find out whether water is safe to drink or not. Gives a basic yes or no. For purposes of short term drinking - trace poisons or other impurities will not be detected.

spell.name: Eye of Ultramarine
spell.description: A spell to determine the location of the nearest body of water. It actually works by trying to summon a ethereal water, and noting where it comes from. The spell may attract the attention of water based elemental creatures.

spell.name: Sight of Teri
spell.description: Upon casting this spell, the Shek-Pvar is able to see through all natural darkness. She cannot see light, but perceives the world in shades of grey. The sight extends to the area of the spell.

spell.name: Curse of Balrin
spell.description: Summons ethereal water at the point specified, which covers an area determined by the limits of the spell, up to a height of three metres. The water remains in place while the Shek-Pvar concentrates on it. Once concentration is ceased, the water will collapse and flow as per normal water, though it evaporates with a half life of about a minute. Creatures caught in the ethereal water drown in about twice the time as normal.

spell.name: Evo's Sweat
spell.description: Causes a target creature up to size six to begin loosing moisture, breaking out in a cold sweat. If affected, they must make a further stamina roll each minute, at a difficulty of 10 + 5/minute passed. Failure means one long term fatigue is gained. Once maximum fatigue is gained, they acrue wound levels until they die.

spell.name: Hewgon's Exodus
spell.boost: +60 The Shek-Pvar can cast spells from shadow form
spell.description: The Shek-Pvar is able to move his spirit into his shadow, and detach his shadow from his body. The shadow can perceive the world, and move around at will, but cannot affect the real world. It can be affected by magic which affects Odivshe elementals. The Shek-Pvar knows where his body is, and on termination of the spell, will return to it. The shadow dies if the body dies. The shadow can only exist in darkness, or a shadowed area. It is always two dimensional, laid upon a surface.

spell.name: Figure of Aumos
spell.description: The caster changes into water, immediately behaving as normal water except that her 'body' will remain continguous. She is unconscious whilst in this form, and will reform when the spell's duration expires. The water will tend to float to the surface if it is in a large body of normal water, and remain near the shore. Clothing and equipment are not affected.

spell.name: Daenin's Eternal Font
spell.boost: +80 Water can be caused to 'rain' over 15m radius area
spell.description: Creates pure, clean, cool, mundane water which flows from the caster's hands at a rate of ten litres a round all the time the spell is concentrated on. The rate of flow may be changed from a trickle up to maximum rate at any time.

spell.name: Aumos' Frozen Corpse
spell.description: Chills a target up to size five to 4 degrees celcius if they fail their resistence roll. This will generally have the effect of killing a living creature.

spell.name: Orb of Aumos
spell.description: Creates a small orb of ethereal ice which can be thrown at a target, using the Shek-Pvar's through skill at +20. If it touches a target, it immediatly causes +50 cold damage, ignoring any metal armour. Any metal it touches becomes brittle, and will shatter if stressed. For each wound level caused, the target also suffers fatigue. Other creatures within 15m of the initial target suffer +30 damage for the orb's effects. Damage is also suffered each following round, though it is reduced by 10 each round.

spell.name: Daenin's Icy Doom
spell.description: Connects the affected area to the essence of Odivshe for a short time, sucking all heat out of anything touched. Water will freeze solid, and living creatures will immediately die if they fail their stamina resistence roll. The ground and air will be extremely cold until it warms naturally, and all which remain in the area afterwards will suffer +30 damage each round, which ignores armour. A hot summers day will warm the area in an hour. During winter, it may take several hours.
